title: Mother of the groom wears the only two colors she was told NOT to wear, wives online insist he put his foot down or his mother will ruin his marriage: ‘This is about you and your fiancé’
description: Are we crazy to think that it's pretty common knowledge not to wear white to a wedding that you are not the bride of unless otherwise specifically informed to? Like, that's a well-known rule in wedding edict, right?… Apparently not! Sure, there are other cultures that say otherwise, but for a traditional American wedding, the kind you see in Hollywood rom-coms, it's pretty obvious that only the bride wears white, and if you show up in white you are the biggest entitled person ever. And yet, according to the plethora of stories online of people still showing up in white to weddings, this still tends to happen all of the time.  In this case, it's the mother of the groom who wants to show up in white. But not only in white, she wants to show up in the only two colors that her son specifically told her not to wear…
author: Elna McHilderson
